other.description: Each time an attack targets this model, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than this model’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
other.name: Advanced Quantum Shielding

other.description: While a friendly Necrons unit is within 6" of this model, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.
other.name: Carrier Wave (Aura)

wargear.description: Once per battle, at the end of any phase, select one friendly Necrons Infantry or Necrons Mounted unit within 6" of the bearer and resurrect that unit. When you do, that unit’s Reanimation Protocols are activated, reanimating D6 wounds rather than D3 when doing so. You cannot resurrect more than one unit per turn.
wargear.name: Resurrection Orb

datasheets.fluff: Some Necron nobles ride to battle enthroned on Catacomb Command Barges. These armoured skimmers beam out carrier waves that bear a noble’s orders directly to the dynasty’s legions, while also providing them with quantum shielding, heavy gauss firepower and a fast-moving platform from which to fight.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: gauss cannon; staff of light.
datasheets.name: Catacomb Command Barge
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 resurrection orb.
This model’s gauss cannon can be replaced with 1 tesla cannon.
This model’s staff of light can be replaced with 1 Overlord’s blade.

other.description: Each time an enemy unit selects this model as the target of a charge, subtract 2 from the Charge roll (this is not cumulative with any other reductions to that Charge roll).
other.name: Gravitational Field

datasheets.fluff: Tesseract Arks are rare war machines of immense power, containing a singularity chamber that holds in stasis a fragment of a dying star. Siphoning off this cosmic energy, the Tesseract Ark can unleash terrible destruction, blasting foes with solar fire or excoriating particle winds, all while shielding itself within a field of gravitational distortion.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: tesseract singularity chamber; 2 tesla cannons; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Tesseract Ark
wargear: This model’s 2 tesla cannons can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 2 gauss cannons ◦ 2 particle beamers

other.description: In your Shooting phase, each time you select a target for this model’s twin tesla destructor, roll one D6 for the target unit and one D6 for every other enemy unit within 3" of the target unit. On a 5+, the unit being rolled for is struck by arcing energies; after resolving all of this model’s attacks against the target unit, each unit struck by arcing energies suffers D3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Malevolent Arcing

datasheets.fluff: Slow-moving but deadly, Annihilation Barges serve as anti-infantry fire support platforms. They are often deployed to watch over important strategic locations, gliding serenely into position upon a cushion of repulsion energies before unleashing furious storms of eldritch lightning from their massive cannons.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: gauss cannon; twin tesla destructor; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Annihilation Barge
wargear: This model’s gauss cannon can be replaced with 1 tesla cannon.

other.description: In your Command phase, select one friendly Canoptek Scarab Swarm unit within 6" of this unit. One destroyed model is returned to that Canoptek Scarab Swarm unit for each SPYDER model in this unit.
other.name: Canoptek Swarm

wargear.description: While a friendly Necrons Vehicle unit is within 6" of the bearer, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
wargear.name: Fabricator Claw Array (Aura)

wargear.description: While a friendly Necrons unit is within 6" of the bearer, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds and Psychic Attacks.
wargear.name: Gloom Prism (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Canoptek Spyders are formidable control-and-repair constructs, augmented with battlefield support systems. Whether blasting enemies with particle beamers, warding off empyric energies with gloom prisms or fabricating and unleashing fresh waves of Canoptek Scarabs, they are a force to be reckoned with.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: automaton claws.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Spyders
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 fabricator claw array.
Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 gloom prism.
Any number of models can each be equipped with 2 particle beamers.

While such a model is on this platform, that model’s ranged weapons have the [HEAVY] ability. Any friendly model can be set up or end any type of move on the ramps or platform sections of this FORTIFICATION.

datasheets.fluff: Triarch Stalkers are agile combat walkers whose heavy firepower makes them excellent tank-hunters and anti-infantry assault units both. As though their focused blasts of energy and flame were not enough, they can also augment the targeting of nearby Necron forces to further punish the foe.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heat ray; Stalker’s forelimbs.
datasheets.name: Triarch Stalker
wargear: This model’s heat ray can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 particle shredder ◦ 1 heavy gauss cannon array

In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models. If the battle ends and this FORTIFICATION is not on the battlefield, it is destroyed.

If it does, select one of those NECRON WARRIORS units; that unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate. The same NECRON WARRIORS unit cannot be selected for this ability more than once per turn.
other.name: Repair Barge

datasheets.fluff: Ghost Arks are repair barges that glide amidst the ranks of the Necron legions, gathering up and repairing those androids too wrecked to reconstruct themselves and keep fighting. These vehicles are often pressed into service as armoured transports, advancing to disgorge fresh waves of fully repaired Necrons directly into the fight.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 gauss flayer arrays; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Ghost Ark
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 10 Necron Warrior models and 1 Necrons Infantry Character model.

datasheets.fluff: Canoptek Doomstalkers stride with eerie grace. Whether prowling their masters’ armouries as tireless sentinels or providing mobile fire support to the Necron legions, the Doomstalkers annihilate all those who dare stand against them with searing salvoes from their doomsday blasters.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: doomsday blaster; twin gauss flayer; Doomstalker limbs.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Doomstalker

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.description: At the end of the Fight phase, if there are no models currently embarked within this TRANSPORT, you can select one friendly Necrons Infantry unit wholly within 6" of this TRANSPORT. Unless that unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, it can embark within this TRANSPORT.
other.name: Translocation Beams

other.description: This model can be set up in the Reinforcements step of your first, second or third Movement phase, regardless of any mission rules.
other.name: Quantum Invader

datasheets.fluff: Many Necron invasions begin with Night Scythes flitting through a world’s void defences. Potent aerial fighters in their own right, Night Scythes also employ invasion beams to generate captive wormholes through which invading infantry can march direct from distant Necron tomb worlds to begin their conquests anew.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: twin tesla destructor; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Night Scythe
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 1 Necrons Infantry unit.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

Each time this model targets an enemy unit with its heavy death ray, your opponent must declare if that unit will stand firm or duck for cover:
■ If it stands firm, when resolving attacks against that unit with that weapon this phase, a successful unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
■ If it ducks for cover, until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
other.name: Atavistic Instigation

datasheets.fluff: The Doom Scythe is a terror weapon whose wailing engines evoke atavistic horror in the luckless foe. Their primary armament, the heavy death ray, is more frightening still, for wherever its searing energy beam carves through the enemy’s ranks, it leaves nothing but blasted wreckage in its wake.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy death ray; twin tesla destructor; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Doom Scythe

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Overwhelming Obliteration

datasheets.fluff: The Doomsday Ark is a direct-fire plasma artillery piece so powerful that it can threaten even the super-heavy war engines of the lesser races. This vehicle is solely dedicated to overwhelming long-ranged firepower, even diverting energy from its motive functions in order to unleash absolute obliteration upon the foe.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: doomsday cannon; 2 gauss flayer arrays; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Doomsday Ark

datasheets.fluff: Shards of the C’tan serve the Necrons as enslaved living weapons. Greatest amongst them are the Transcendent C’tan, whose fury and power are so terrifying that they must be trammelled using the full might of Necron technology. When their cosmic powers are unleashed, reality itself is torn asunder.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: seismic assault; crackling tendrils.
datasheets.name: Transcendent C’tan

damaged.description: While this model has 1-7 wounds remaining, subtract 4 from its Objective Control characteristic and each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

That unit is then set up anywhere on the battlefield that is wholly within 6" of this model and not within Engagement Range of any enemy models. That unit cannot declare a charge this turn.
other.name: Eternity Gate

datasheets.fluff: A Monolith is capable of skimming across the battlefield, or even descending from space. It can slaughter foes with its array of potent weapons, heal damage with the living metal of its hull and even teleport Necron reinforcements into battle through its shimmering eternity gate.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 4 gauss flux arcs; particle whip; portal of exile.
datasheets.name: Monolith
wargear: This model’s 4 gauss flux arcs can be replaced with 4 death rays.

Until the end of the turn, halve the Move characteristic of models in that unit and halve Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit. In addition, if that unit can FLY, until the start of your next Movement phase, roll one D6 each time that unit ends any type of move: on a 4+, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Gravitic Pulse

datasheets.fluff: The Necron Obelisk is a slab-sided war engine designed to ensure air superiority. When enemy aircraft draw near, the Obelisk unleashes a powerful gravitic pulse that races out through the skies over the battlefield and swats the foe’s fighters and airborne troops to the ground like luckless insects.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 4 tesla spheres; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Obelisk

other.description: Each time an attack is allocated to this model, halve the Damage characteristic of that attack.

datasheets.fluff: Mephet’ran the Deceiver was ever the most duplicitous of his monstrous brood. Even shattered and bound within a restraining necrodermis, each Shard of the Deceiver still radiates a potent blend of deadly truths and bewildering lies against which the fallible senses of mortal beings possess no defence.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: cosmic insanity; golden fists.
datasheets.name: C’tan Shard of the Deceiver

datasheets.fluff: Shards of the Void Dragon fill the air around them with a searing scream of distorted static. With a gesture they can unmake the war engines of lesser beings, dragging the resultant disintegrating matter into themselves like the gravity well of a black hole and using it to replenish their own, ever flickering forms.
keywords: C’tan Shard of the Void Dragon

Aza’gorod he was, the Inevitable Blade; his spectral form, cowl of shadows and flashing scythe are said to have spawned countless avatars of death in the legends of primitive cultures the entire galaxy over.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: gaze of death; Scythe of the Nightbringer.
datasheets.name: C’tan Shard of the Nightbringer

datasheets.fluff: The Seraptek Heavy Construct wields energies that can disintegrate organic and mechanical matter. Despite its bulk, the Seraptek is an agile machine, exerting dominance over nearby Canoptek-class constructs. What purpose this colossus was originally intended for is unknown, but as a weapon of war it is truly devastating.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 singularity generators; titanic forelimbs.
datasheets.name: Seraptek Heavy Construct
wargear: This model’s 2 singularity generators can be replaced with 2 synaptic obliterators and 2 transdimensional projectors.

datasheets.fluff: The Silent King rides to war aboard his dais of dominion, flanked by the phaerons of his Triarch and orbited by crackling noctilith menhirs. He unleashes godlike powers of annihilation upon his dismayed foes, even as his absolute authority radiates out to empower the Necron legions and drive them to inevitable victory.
datasheets.loadout: Szarekh is equipped with: Sceptre of Eternal Glory; Staff of Stars; Weapons of the Final Triarch.
datasheets.name: The Silent King

Until the end of the phase, this model is equipped with those weapons in addition to its other weapons (this model cannot make attacks with any other C’tan Powers weapon you did not select in this way this phase).
other.name: Powers of the C’tan

datasheets.fluff: These super-heavy war engines channel the furious might of imprisoned Transcendent C’tan Shards, unleashing one unnatural phenomenon after another upon the foe. Yet should they ever be destroyed and the C’tan inside freed, the god-shard’s wrath will be great indeed, and all should fear its rampage.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 4 tesla spheres; armoured bulk.
datasheets.name: Tesseract Vault

other.description: Once per turn, in your opponent’s Shooting phase, when an enemy unit makes a ranged attack that targets a friendly Necrons unit within 3" of a model with this ability, after that enemy unit has shot, one model with this ability that is within 3" of that target can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
other.name: Multi-threat Eliminator

other.description: Once per turn, one unit from your army with this ability can be targeted with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem for 0CP, even if you have already used that Stratagem on a different unit this phase. In addition, each time you target this unit with the Fire Overwatch Stratagem, while resolving that Stratagem, hits are scored on unmodified Hit rolls of 2+.
other.name: Inescapable Death

datasheets.fluff: Hexmark Destroyers were once Deathmarks. Bursting from their dimensional oubliettes like ambush predators, these hunchbacked monsters unleash inescapable hails of enmitic fire. Independent ocular targeting and optimised firing patterns leave their prey with no escape.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: enmitic disintegrator pistols; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Hexmark Destroyer

other.description: Each time an attack targets this model, if this model is within range of an objective marker, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. In addition, each time this model makes an attack that targets a unit within range of an objective marker, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
other.name: Aggressor Guardian

wargear.description: While a friendly Necrons unit is within 6" of the bearer, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds and Psychic Attacks.
wargear.name: Gloom Prism (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Both guardian and aggressor, the Tomb Sentinel is a heavily modified variant of the Tomb Stalker, which forgoes that device’s close-combat ability in favour of an exile cannon. This ancient weapon casts its target into other dimensional realms beyond the material universe, removing trespassers and upstarts as though they never existed.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: exile cannon; Tomb Sentinel claws; gloom prism.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Tomb Sentinel

other.description: You can target this unit with the Heroic Intervention Stratagem for 0CP, and can do so even if you have already used that Stratagem on a different unit this phase.
other.name: Snaking Ambush

wargear.description: While a friendly Necrons unit is within 6" of the bearer, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability against mortal wounds and Psychic Attacks.
wargear.name: Gloom Prism (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Armed with gauss weaponry and rows of razor-sharp legs, Tomb Stalkers are unliving machines built to protect the sepulchres of Necron lords. Its arcane senses can detect life through hundreds of metres of solid rock, and once its prey has been detected, it closes in for the kill, using a form of phase field to part matter like water.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: gauss slicers; Tomb Stalker claws; gloom prism.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Tomb Stalker

other.description: At the end of your opponent’s turn, if this unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can remove this unit from the battlefield. In the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set it up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
other.name: Tunnelling Horrors

wargear.description: Once per battle for each Plasmacyte this unit has, when this unit is selected to fight, you can use this ability. If you do, until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
wargear.name: Plasmacyte

datasheets.fluff: Repugnant to other Necrons, Ophydian Destroyers echo elements of servile Canoptek Wraiths and reviled Flayed Ones in their murder-optimised bodies. Tunnelling through solid ferrocrete with frenzied violence and flickers of dimensional displacement, they burst into view to ambush, hack and rend their prey apart.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Ophydian hyperphase weapons.
datasheets.name: Ophydian Destroyers
wargear: For every 3 models in this unit, this unit can have 1 Plasmacyte.

other.description: Once per turn, in the Reinforcements step of your opponent’s Movement phase, when an enemy unit is set up on the battlefield from Reserves within 18" of and visible to this unit, this unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but must only target that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
other.name: Hyperspace Hunters

datasheets.fluff: No target can evade the Deathmarks. Watching from dimensional oubliettes, these expert snipers track enemy movements, communications and even teleport signatures before striking. They do so in a blaze of synaptic disintegrator fire that shreds not only their victims’ bodies, but also their very minds.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: synaptic disintegrator; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Deathmarks

other.description: You can re-roll Charge rolls made for this unit, and this unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Relentless Combatants

datasheets.fluff: Triarch Praetorians fight tirelessly to uphold the ancient dynastic codes of their people. Whether blasting the foe with antimatter particles, impaling them on their flickering voidblades or immolating them with their rods of covenant, the Praetorians’ gravity displacement packs and combat prowess make them truly deadly.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: rod of covenant.
datasheets.name: Triarch Praetorians
wargear: All models in this unit can each have their rod of covenant replaced with 1 particle caster and 1 voidblade.

other.description: At the end of the Fight phase, if this model destroyed one of more models this phase, until the end of the battle, add 3" to the range of its Mechanical Augmentation ability to a max of 12.
other.name: Atomic Energy Manipulator

other.description: While a friendly Necrons BATTLELINE unit is within 3" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1, and each time an attack targets that unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
other.name: Mechanical Augmentation (Aura)

other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more other friendly Necrons units, this model has the Lone Operative ability.
other.name: Illuminor

datasheets.fluff: Illuminor Szeras is a ghoulish bio-scientist who haunts the battlefield to gather luckless living specimens. He is a master of technomantic lore and android augmentation, employing horrible arcanoscientific instruments to disassemble his enemies, even as he fortifies the living metal forms of his allies.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Eldritch Lance; impaling legs.
datasheets.name: Illuminor Szeras

other.description: While a friendly Necrons unit is within 3" of this model, each time that unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate, that unit reanimates an additional D3 wounds.
other.name: Nanoscarab Reanimation Beam (Aura)

datasheets.fluff: Canoptek Reanimators prowl the Necron lines, shooting out ethereal beams swarming with nanoscarabs. Necrons touched by these eerie lights stagger to their feet, resurrected, repaired and ready to fight again. Foes are less fortunate, wailing in agony as their atoms are torn apart and recombined in a hideous, gory fashion.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 atomiser beams; Reanimator’s claws.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Reanimator

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack, if the target of that attack is Below Half-strength, a successful Hit roll scores a Critical Hit.
other.name: Flesh Hunger

datasheets.fluff: Flayed Ones keen shrill hunting cries as they fall upon the foe, talons flashing. Infected with the gruesome Flayer virus, the Flayed Ones attempt to gorge themselves upon the flesh and blood of their butchered foes, gore drizzling through their mechanical forms as they seek to slake a thirst they can never quench.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: flayer claws.
datasheets.name: Flayed Ones

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, select one enemy unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the phase, each time a friendly Necrons model makes an attack that targets that unit, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1
other.name: Damaged Armour

datasheets.fluff: Canoptek Acanthrites are created for a single purpose: the destruction of those who have dared to claim the ancient empire of the Necrontyr. Acanthrites’ articulated bodies are armed with hyper-phased voidblades and high-powered thermal cutting beams, enabling them to carve through and dissemble solid matter as though it were not there.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: cutting beam; voidblade.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Acanthrites

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, at the end of your Command phase, if that unit is within range of an objective marker you control, it remains under your control, even if you have no models within range of it, until your opponent controls it at start or end of any turn.
other.name: Ancient Collector

other.description: At the start of your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, you can select one other friendly Necrons Infantry Character model on the battlefield (excluding SKORPEKH LORD or EPIC HERO models). The selected model is destroyed (ignoring any rules that are triggered when a model is destroyed) and this model is put in its place, with all of its wounds remaining (if the selected model was leading a unit, this model now attaches to that unit as its Leader).
other.name: Surrogate Hosts

datasheets.fluff: A thief of moments in history, Trazyn takes to the battlefield to acquire that which cunning cannot secure. His Empathic Obliterator triggers psionic shock waves that kill not only his immediate victim, but those of a like mind nearby, while his ability to leap from one surrogate body to the next ensures he is hard to slay indeed.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Lychguard ■ Necron Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Empathic Obliterator.
datasheets.name: Trazyn the Infinite

other.description: At the start of your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, you gain 1CP.
other.name: Grand Strategist

other.description: Once per battle, at the end of your Command phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, roll one D6 for each enemy unit within 12" of this model: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Lord of the Storm

datasheets.fluff: Imotekh is a sublimely skilled strategist, wielding his armies with hyperlogical skill and unleashing deadly strategic ploys. In battle he incinerates enemies with his Gauntlet of Fire, blasts them with pan-dimensional energies from his Staff of the Destroyer or humbles them in punishing one-on-one duels.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Lychguard ■ Necron Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Gauntlet of Fire; Staff of the Destroyer.
datasheets.name: Imotekh the Stormlord

other.description: At the start of your opponent’s Shooting phase, select one enemy Vehicle unit within 12" of and visible to this model. That unit must take a Leadership test. If that test is passed, until the end of the phase, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll; if that test is failed, that unit is not eligible to shoot this phase.
other.name: Mind in the Machine

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.
other.name: Lord of the Pyrrhian Eternals

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: tachyon arrow; warscythe.
datasheets.name: Anrakyr The Traveller

abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.
abilities.name: One Shot

other.description: Each time an attack is allocated to this model, subtract 1 from that attack’s Damage characteristic.
other.name: Implacable Resilience

other.description: Once per battle round, one unit from your army with this ability can be targeted with a Stratagem for 0CP, even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.
other.name: My Will Be Done

wargear.description: Once per battle, while the bearer is leading a unit, at the end of any phase, it can resurrect that unit if it is on the battlefield. When you do, that unit’s Reanimation Protocols are activated, reanimating D6 wounds rather than D3 when doing so. You cannot resurrect more than one unit per turn.
wargear.name: Resurrection Orb

datasheets.fluff: Overlords lead the Necron dynasties in battle. Their android minds are tremendously swift, their bodies implacably resilient and their weapons eldritch, ancient and lethal. Yet it is the Overlords’ indomitable wills that are perhaps their most fearsome assets, for with these they drive entire armies to war.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Lychguard ■ Necron Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: tachyon arrow; Overlord’s blade.
datasheets.name: Overlord

abilities.description: The bearer can only shoot with this weapon once per battle.
abilities.name: One Shot

wargear: If this model is not equipped with a tachyon arrow, it can be equipped with 1 resurrection orb.
This model’s tachyon arrow and Overlord’s blade can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 staff of light ◦ 1 voidscythe

other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model and roll one D6: on a 2-5, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Crimson Harvest

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, melee weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
other.name: United In Destruction

datasheets.fluff: Skorpekh Lords have fallen far from their noble beginnings, allowing an obsession with slaughter to twist their bodies and minds. Lurching forward on tripod bodies, their enmitic annihilators blast victims messily apart as their claws and blades lash out to reap a crimson harvest across the battlefield.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Skorpekh Destroyers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: enmitic annihilator; flensing claw; hyperphase harvester.
datasheets.name: Skorpekh Lord

other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets an enemy unit that is Below Half-strength, you can re-roll the Hit roll and you can re-roll the Wound roll.
other.name: Driven by Hatred

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, a successful unmodifed Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
other.name: Destroyer Cult

wargear.description: Once per battle, while the bearer is leading a unit, at the end of any phase, it can resurrect that unit if it is on the battlefield. When you do, that unit’s Reanimation Protocols are activated, reanimating D6 wounds rather than D3 when doing so. You cannot resurrect more than one unit per turn.
wargear.name: Resurrection Orb

wargear.description: The bearer has the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
wargear.name: Nanoscarab Amulet

datasheets.fluff: Lokhust Lords skim into battle on swift grav-sled bodies. Driven by nihilistic hatred, their every optimised strike slaughters swathes of the foe. Should the enemy dare strike back, they must watch in despair as the pulse of a resurrection orb or the silvery mites spilling from a nanoscarab amulet repair the monomaniacal warrior, who rises ready to destroy again.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Lokhust Destroyers ■ Lokhust Heavy Destroyers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: staff of light.
datasheets.name: Lokhust Lord
wargear: This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 nanoscarab amulet ◦ 1 resurrection orb
This model’s staff of light can be replaced with 1 Lord’s blade.

other.description: Each time this model’s unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in that unit. In addition, each time a model in that unit makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, until that move is finished, it can move horizontally through models and terrain features (it cannot finish a move on top of another model or its base).
other.name: Translocation Shroud

other.description: Once per battle round, one unit from your army with this ability can be targeted with a Stratagem for OCP, even if you have already targeted a different unit with that Stratagem this phase.
other.name: My Will Be Done

wargear.description: Once per battle, while the bearer is leading a unit, at the end of any phase, it can resurrect that unit if it is on the battlefield. When you do, that unit’s Reanimation Protocols are activated, reanimating D6 wounds rather than D3 when doing so. You cannot resurrect more than one unit per turn.
wargear.name: Resurrection Orb

datasheets.fluff: With a translocation shroud drawn from their dynastic vaults, an Overlord can drive their android warriors in spectral surges towards the foe. Their living metal bodies phase swiftly through nether-realms allowing them to pass through rigid defences and even the flesh of mortal guardians to reach whatever prey or prize the Overlord demands.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units:  ■ Immortals ■ Lychguard ■ Necron Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Overlord’s blade; resurrection orb.
datasheets.name: Overlord with Translocation Shroud

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model’s unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, that unit can make a Normal move of up to 5" as if it were your Movement phase. If it does, until the end of the turn, that unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
other.name: Chronometron

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
other.name: Timesplinter Mantle

datasheets.fluff: Chronomancers are Crypteks who harness temporal energies, using arcane staves to trap foes in bubbles of slowed time or rapidly age them with entropic blasts. Their timesplinter mantles use crystallised moments to confound enemy blows, while their chronometrons hasten allies through time itself.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leads.extra: You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Chronomancer’s stave.
datasheets.name: Chronomancer

If it does, until the end of the phase, triple the Attacks and Strength characteristics of this model’s Staff of Tomorrow and every successful Wound roll made for this model’s attacks scores a Critical Wound.
other.name: The Stars Are Right

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
other.name: Master Chronomancer

datasheets.fluff: Orikan is a master astromancer, using his knowledge of astral conjunctions to predict the tides of battle and empower himself with cosmic energies. He supplements these skills with chronomantic abilities that allow him to see events before they happen and know just where to aim his blows.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leads.extra: You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Staff of Tomorrow.
datasheets.name: Orikan the Diviner

other.description: At the end of your Movement phase, you can select one friendly Necrons model within 6" of the bearer. That model regains up to D3 lost wounds. Each model can only be selected for this ability once per turn.
other.name: Technomancer

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 5+ ability.
other.name: Rites of Reanimation

datasheets.fluff: Technomancers possess the power to augment and swiftly repair Necron units in the field. By using a Canoptek cloak – a techno-arcane mantle attached to a spiderlike construct that generates an anti-gravity field – they can flit swiftly to wherever they are needed most, or wherever they spy rich pickings of precious resources.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Canoptek Wraiths ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leads.extra: You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: staff of light.
datasheets.name: Technomancer

other.description: In the Battle-Shock step of your opponent’s Command phase, if an enemy unit that is below its Starting Strength is within 6" of this model, that enemy unit must take a Battle-Shock test, subtracting 1 from the test when it does so.
other.name: Nightmare Shroud (Aura)

other.description: Once per turn, at the start of your Command, Movement, Shooting, Charge or Fight phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of this model. That unit must take a Battle-Shock test, subtracting 1 from the test when it does so.
other.name: Harbinger of Despair

datasheets.fluff: Psychomancers study the science of fear. They are expert manipulators, conjuring phantasms and temporary hard-light constructs that trigger primal survival instincts in their victims’ minds, or overload even the most advanced sensoria. No being is safe from the creeping tendrils of the Psychomancer’s art.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leads.extra: You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: abyssal lance.
datasheets.name: Psychomancer

other.description: In your Shooting phase, select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this model and roll 4D6: for each 4+, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
other.name: Living Lightning

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, a successful unmodifed Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
other.name: Harbinger of Destruction

datasheets.fluff: Plasmancers are unsubtle annihilators. They are capable of wielding energy as a weapon itself rather than needing to bind it to other forms. Arcs of unstable lightning leap from their forms to wrack nearby foes, and with a gesture these Crypteks can channel those same energies into searing ranged blasts.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

leads.extra: You can attach this model to one of the above units even if one Royal Warden or Noble model has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plasmic lance.
datasheets.name: Plasmancer

other.description: Once per battle, at the start of any phase, you can select one friendly Necrons unit that is Battle-shocked and within 12" of this model. That unit is no longer Battle-shocked.
other.name: Engrammatic Logic

other.description: This model’s unit is eligible to shoot or declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
other.name: Adaptive Strategy

datasheets.fluff: Royal Wardens ensure their lord’s will is carried out by the dynasty’s vast armies. They possess the initiative to adapt the strategies of the phalanxes under their command with engrammatic logic. While they retain independence of thought, protocols buried deep within their living metal cortices render them unquestioningly loyal.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Immortals ■ Necron Warriors
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: relic gauss blaster; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Royal Warden

other.description: While this model is in the same unit as Nemesor Zahndrekh, Character models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.
other.name: The Vargard’s Duty

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.
other.name: Ghostwalk Mantle

leads.extra: This model can be attached to a unit even if Nemesor Zahndrekh has already been attached to it. If it is, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: warscythe.
datasheets.name: Vargard Obyron

other.name: Relentless March

other.description: While this model is leading a unit, you can target that unit with Stratagems even when it is Battle-shocked.
other.name: The Lord’s Will

wargear.name: Resurrection Orb

datasheets.name: Lord

This model’s staff of light can be replaced with 1 Lord’s blade.

other.name: Counter-tactics

other.description:
While this model is leading a unit, at the start of your Command phase, roll one D6: until the start of your next Command phase, weapons equipped by models in that unit gain the ability below that corresponds with that roll:
■ 1-2: [SUSTAINED HITS 1]
■ 3-4: [LETHAL HITS]
■ 5-6: [DEVASTATING WOUNDS]
other.name: Transient Madness

datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: staff of light.
datasheets.name: Nemesor Zahndrekh

other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this unit has shot, it can make a Normal move of up to 6". If it does, until the end of the turn, this unit is not eligible to declare a charge.
other.name: Evasion Engrams

wargear.description: Ranged weapons equipped by the bearer have the [IGNORES COVER] ability.
wargear.name: Nebuloscope

wargear.description: The bearer has a Save characteristic of 3+ and a Move characteristic of 8".
wargear.name: Shieldvanes

wargear.description: The bearer has the Stealth ability.
wargear.name: Shadowloom

datasheets.fluff: Tomb Blades are fast assault skimmers whose spiralling attack patterns are based on fractal hyperlogic. They are well armed, often afforded extra protection by the addition of darkness-generating shadowlooms or armoured shieldvanes. Others employ nebuloscopes to target the foe through even solid fortifications.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: twin gauss blaster; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Tomb Blades
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with 1 shieldvanes.
Any number of models can each be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 nebuloscope ◦ 1 shadowloom
Any number of models can each have their twin gauss blaster replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 particle beamer ◦ 1 twin tesla carbine

other.description: Each time this unit ends a Normal move, you can select one enemy unit it moved over during that move and roll one D6 for each model in this unit: for each 4+, that enemy unit suffers 1 mortal wound.
other.name: Wraith Form

datasheets.fluff: These constructs serve as the eyes and ears of their masters while tomb worlds slumber, and as spectral assassins once their armies march out to war. Their dimensional destabilisation matrices allow them to phase in and out of reality, passing through solid objects and sliding their talons through armour, flesh and bone.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: vicious claws.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Wraiths
wargear: Any number of models can each be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 particle caster ◦ 1 transdimensional beamer
Any number of models can each have their vicious claws replaced with whip coils.

other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, if this unit is within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, you can select one model in this unit to destroy. If you do, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of that model and roll one D6, adding 1 to the result if that unit is a Vehicle. On a 2-5, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6+, that unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.
other.name: Self-destruction

other.description: While an enemy unit is within Engagement Range of this unit, subtract 1 from the Objective Control characteristic of models in that enemy unit (to a minimum of 1). While this unit is within 6" of one or more friendly CRYPTEK models, the Objective Control characteristic of models in this unit is 1.
other.name: Chittering swarm

datasheets.fluff: Canoptek Scarabs attack in skimming swarms. They descend upon the enemy with high-pitched chitters before breaking down infantry and tanks alike into raw energy with their feeder mandibles. Often attacking as the first wave of a Necron assault, these mechanical insectoids spread fear and destruction.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: feeder mandibles.
datasheets.name: Canoptek Scarab Swarms

other.description: Each time a CRYPTOTHRALL model in this unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and it is then removed from play.
other.name: Systematic Vigour

other.description: While this unit is in the same unit as a Cryptek model, that Cryptek model has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.
other.name: Bound Creation

special.description: At the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, this unit can join one other unit from your army that is being led by a Cryptek model (a unit cannot have more than one Cryptothralls unit joined to it). If it does, until the end of the battle, every model in this unit counts as being part of that Bodyguard unit, and that Bodyguard unit’s Starting Strength is increased accordingly.
special.name: Cryptek Retinue

datasheets.fluff: Some Crypteks are accompanied by bound Cryptothralls that act as slaves and bodyguards. These hunched and sinister beings are not truly sentient, but are rather construct creatures enslaved to the Cryptek’s will and engrammatically compelled to protect their master with their living metal bodies and fierce, short-ranged weaponry.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: scouring eye; scythed limbs.
datasheets.name: Cryptothralls

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If this unit made a Charge move this turn, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
other.name: Whirling Onslaught

wargear.description: Once per battle for each Plasmacyte this unit has, when this unit is selected to fight, you can use this ability. If you do, until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
wargear.name: Plasmacyte

datasheets.fluff: Skorpekh Destroyers favour overwhelming close-quarters violence to slaughter their victims. Though ungainly off the battlefield, in combat their tripod limbs allow them to pass through enemy lines in a madcap pirouette of slashing hyperphase blades, nigh on impossible to evade or parry.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Skorpekh hyperphase weapons.
datasheets.name: Skorpekh Destroyers
wargear: For every 3 models in this unit, this unit can have 1 Plasmacyte.

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets the closest eligible enemy unit, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the target of that attack is within range of an objective marker your opponent controls, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
other.name: Hard-wired for Destruction

datasheets.fluff: Lokhust Destroyers rely on speed and firepower to annihilate any life they encounter. Their repulsor-sled bodies and augmented kinetic compensators ensure they can fire on the move without reduction in efficiency, and their speed allows them to run even the swiftest prey to ground.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: gauss cannon; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Lokhust Destroyers

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack with an enmitic exterminator that targets a unit (excluding Monsters and Vehicles], re-roll a Wound roll of 1. Each time a model in this unit makes an attack with a gauss destructor that targets a Monster or Vehicle, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.
other.name: Optimised for Slaughter

datasheets.fluff: The Destroyer Cults think nothing of sacrificing their physical forms to optimise themselves for slaughter. Lokhust Heavy Destroyers skim to battle upon repulsor-sled bodies, their upper limbs bound into gauss destructors or enmitic exterminators with which they decimate their foes with devastating blasts from afar.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: gauss destructor; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Lokhust Heavy Destroyers
wargear: Any number of models can each have their gauss destructor replaced with 1 enmitic exterminator.

other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1. If the target of that attack is an enemy unit within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Wound roll instead.
other.name: Implacable Eradication

datasheets.fluff: Once the shock troops of the Necrontyr, Immortals still provide their masters with a powerful core of skilled soldiery aeons later. More advanced than Necron Warriors, they can employ a number of strategies even without command, and their firepower makes them deadly in close or midrange engagements.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: gauss blaster; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Immortals
wargear: All models in this unit can each have their gauss blaster replaced with 1 tesla carbine.

other.description: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this FORTIFICATION, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.
other.name: Ancient Cover

other.description: While a friendly Necrons Infantry unit is within 6" of this Fortification, models in that unit have Feel No Pain 6+ ability.
other.name: Reanimation Nodes (Aura)

other.description: While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more Fortifications from your army: ■  That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll. ■  Models in that unit do not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.
other.name: Fortification

special.description: When this unit is first set up on the battlefield, its models do not have to be set up in Unit Coherency. Instead, each model must be set up wholly within 12" of one other model from its unit. From that point on, each model in this unit is treated as a separate unit.
special.name: Deployment

datasheets.fluff: Starsteles were placed upon worlds as territorial markers and silent guardians by jealous Necron nobles. Over the millennia they have become forgotten archaeological curios, or feared sources of superstitious rumour about vanishments and strange lights. Now they awaken again as their masters do.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: transdimensional abductor.
datasheets.name: Convergence of Dominion

other.description: Each time this unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate, you can re-roll the dice to see how many wounds are reanimated.
other.name: Their Number is Legion

datasheets.fluff: Necron Warriors attack in rank upon shambling rank. Individually little more than mindless automata, they are relentless and deadly when commanded en masse. The Warriors’ metallic bodies can self-repair from even the most hideous damage, while their unceasing volleys of fire butcher the foe with mechanical efficiency.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: gauss flayer; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Necron Warriors
wargear: Any number of models can each have their gauss flayer replaced with 1 gauss reaper.

other.description: While a Noble model is leading this unit, each time an attack targets this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than this unit’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.
other.name: Guardian Protocols

wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.
wargear.name: Dispersion Shield

datasheets.fluff: Incapable of disloyalty and clad in forms as resilient and resplendent as their masters’, Lychguard are the ultimate protectors. Whether reaping the foe with warscythes or advancing with dispersion shields locked and hyperphase swords thrumming, at close quarters these bodyguards are nigh on unstoppable.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: warscythe.
datasheets.name: Lychguard
wargear: All models in this unit can each have their warscythe replaced with 1 hyperphase sword and 1 dispersion shield.

enhancements.description: Cryptek model only. Once per phase, when an enemy unit selects the bearer’s unit as a target of a charge, roll one D6: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds.
enhancements.name: Metalodermal Tesla Weave

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack, on a Critical Wound, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
enhancements.name: Ingrained Superiority

enhancements.description: Overlord model only. Each time the bearer’s unit destroys an enemy Character unit, your opponent loses 1CP if they have any.
enhancements.name: Honourable Combatant

enhancements.description: Cryptek model only. Each time your opponent gains a CP as the result of an ability, roll one D6: on a 2+, you also gain 1CP
enhancements.name: Autodivinator

enhancements.description: Cryptek model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, if that unit is wholly within your army’s Power Matrix, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.
enhancements.name: Hyperphasic Fulcrum

enhancements.description: Destroyer Cult model only. At the start of the Fight phase, each enemy unit within Engagement Range of the bearer must take a Battle-shock test.
enhancements.name: Eldritch Nightmare

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. Each time the bearer’s unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll for it. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in the bearer’s unit.
enhancements.name: Hyperspatial Transfer Node

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability
enhancements.name: Enaegic Dermal Bond

enhancements.description: Overlord model only. Each time a melee attack targets the bearer’s unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
enhancements.name: Warrior Noble

enhancements.description: Cryptek model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Infiltrators ability.
enhancements.name: Dimensional Sanctum

enhancements.description: Destroyer Cult model only. Each time an enemy unit within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit is selected to Fall Back, roll one D6: on a 3+, that unit cannot Fall Back this phase and must Remain Stationary.
enhancements.name: Soulless Reaper

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Deep Strike ability.
enhancements.name: Osteoclave Fulcrum

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. Once per battle, at the end of your opponent’s turn, if the bearer’s unit is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, remove that unit from the battlefield. Then, in the Reinforcements step of your next Movement phase, set up that unit anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 9" horizontally away from all enemy models.
enhancements.name: Veil of Darkness

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Stealth ability.
enhancements.name: Nether-realm Casket

enhancements.description: Overlord model only. The bearer’s melee weapons have the [PRECISION] and [ANTI-INFANTRY 5+] abilities.
enhancements.name: Unflinching Will

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If the bearer’s unit was set up on the battlefield this turn, you can re-roll the Hit roll instead.
enhancements.name: Arisen Tyrant

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. In the Fight phase, each time a model in the bearer’s unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.
enhancements.name: Eternal Madness

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. While the bearer is on the battlefield or in Strategic Reserves, add one to the number of units from your army that you can select for the Hyperphasing rule.
enhancements.name: Dimensional Overseer

enhancements.description: Overlord model only. Each time a model in the bearer’s unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within range of an objective marker, you can re-roll the Hit roll.
enhancements.name: Eternal Conqueror

enhancements.description: Necrons model only. While a friendly Necrons unit (excluding Character units) is within 6" of the bearer, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.
enhancements.name: Phasal Subjugator (Aura)

stratagems.effect: Roll one D6: on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers 3 mortal wounds. Your unit can then make a Normal move, but must end that move as close as possible to that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Whatever strange afflictions eat away at the sanity of Destroyers and Flayed Ones, mercy is not one of them.
stratagems.name: Blood-fuelled Cruelty
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that started the phase within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Fall Back move.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model from your unit makes an attack that targets a unit below Starting Strength, add 1 to the Hit roll. If the target is Below Half-strength, add 1 to the Wound roll as well
stratagems.fluff: Where one foe falls, logic dictates all others must follow. Where blood is shed, ever must more flow.
stratagems.name: The Spoor of Frailty
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile-in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3".
stratagems.fluff: Driven into a state of hyperaggression, an Annihilation Legion’s most eager hunters plunge into their prey’s midst to maximise their butchery.
stratagems.name: Pitiless Hunters
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack targets your unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Wreathed in tendrils of transdimensional shadow that intensify their deathly visages, these killing machines evoke such terror that steady aims tremble and blade arms are sapped of strength.
stratagems.name: Masks of Death
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move, but must end that move as close as possible to that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: To strike down one horror is merely to draw the rest of the pack’s insane and murderous focus.
stratagems.name: Insanity’s Ire
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed by the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has shot.

stratagems.effect: Your unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate.
stratagems.fluff: Through some quirk of their kind’s shared insanity, a spark of gruesome satisfaction surges through them with every enemy life snuffed out, triggering quiescent power reserves that drive them onwards.
stratagems.name: Murderous Reanimation
stratagems.target: One Destroyer Cult or Flayed Ones unit from your army that has just destroyed an enemy unit, or just caused an enemy unit that was not Below Half-strength to become Below Half-strength.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: At the end of the phase, set your model back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of any enemy units, with half of its starting number of wounds remaining.
stratagems.fluff: Necron rulers possess enhanced self-repair systems.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Eternal Revenant
stratagems.restrictions: Each model can only be targeted with this Stratagem once per battle.
stratagems.target: One Necrons Infantry Character model from your army that was just destroyed. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Any phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, add 1 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit. In addition, if a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1 (this is not cumulative with any other modifiers that improve Armour Penetration).
stratagems.fluff: Necrons strike with data-augmented accuracy.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Hungry Void
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack that targets a unit within half range, re-roll a Hit roll of 1. If a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, you can re-roll the Hit roll for that attack instead.
stratagems.fluff: The legions employ the strategies of their masters in perfect synchronicity, laying down hails of mechanically coordinated fire.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Conquering Tyrant
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [ASSAULT] ability. In addition, if a Necrons Character is leading your unit, until the end of the phase, you can re-roll Advance rolls made for your unit.
stratagems.fluff: Arcing energies leap from one Necron to the next, lending them unnatural speed and surety.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Sudden Storm
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.

stratagems.effect: Your unit activates its Reanimation Protocols and reanimates D3 wounds (or D3+1 wounds if a Necrons Character is leading your unit).
stratagems.fluff: Nanoscarabs are released in boiling black clouds that whirl about the legions and effect rapid repairs.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Undying Legions
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has resolved its attacks.

stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker within 18" of your Cryptek model. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by friendly Necrons models have the [IGNORES COVER] ability while targeting units within range of that objective marker.
stratagems.fluff: By remotely accessing a hidden engine’s most illuminating protocols, a Cryptek can release the awesome power of a caged solar flare.
stratagems.name: Solar Pulse
stratagems.target: One Cryptek model from your army.
stratagems.when: Start of your Shooting phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time a friendly Canoptek model makes an attack that targets the attacking unit, add 1 to the Hit roll and add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: Vindictive Crypteks often hardwire vengeance subprotocols into the ancient cores of their unliving servants, by which a last act of reprisal is assured.
stratagems.name: Curse of the Cryptek
stratagems.target: One Cryptek model from your army that was destroyed by one of the attacking unit’s attacks. You can use this Stratagem on that model even though it was just destroyed.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12".
stratagems.fluff: With a twist to the fabric of time, a bubble of another moment enshrouds these constructs. Strange emissions from long-dead elder stars or utter darkness from a nighttime far in the future occludes them from their master’s foes.
stratagems.name: Countertemporal Shift
stratagems.target: One Canoptek unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to 6".
stratagems.fluff: Canoptek constructs spent the long Great Sleep in watchful vigilance. Triggering a surge of power, they are capable of responsive manoeuvres to outwit the swiftest of attackers.
stratagems.name: Reactive Subroutines
stratagems.target: One Canoptek unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.

stratagems.effect: Your unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate.
stratagems.fluff: Canoptek constructs use sophisticated metalogic to craft sinister ambushes. Luring the foe in by appearing at suboptimal operation, a surge of reanimation protocols suddenly swells their numbers.
stratagems.name: Suboptimal Facade
stratagems.target: One Canoptek unit from your army that was selected as a target of that charge and is wholly within your army’s Power Matrix.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Charge phase, just after an enemy unit has declared a charge.

stratagems.effect: For each of your Necrons units in Reserves, that Reserves unit’s Reanimation Protocols activate.
stratagems.fluff: There is no rest for Necrons who fall in the service of their master. In dark crypts, their bodies are repaired and they are dispatched once more to war.
stratagems.name: Reanimation Crypts
stratagems.target: Your Necrons Warlord.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have a 4+ invulnerable save.
stratagems.fluff: Necron quantum shielding is a true marvel of techno-arcana. Channelled with energy reserves from the rising tomb structures, the shielding is capable of adaptive remodulation to diffuse and deflect the most powerful enemy attacks.
stratagems.name: Quantum Deflection
stratagems.target: One Necrons Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in the attacking unit have the [HAZARDOUS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Towering war engines rise from an erupting tomb in its defence, directing entropic energies to weaken and fracture the enemies’ own weapons and turning them into dangerous tools only the desperate would use.
stratagems.name: Entropic Damping
stratagems.target: One Titanic model from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks and is within 18" of the attacking unit.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3" horizontally away from all enemy models.
stratagems.fluff: With a sanity-defying mechanism at the heart of the tomb, dynastic astromancers divine the pre-aligned point in space and time where a crucial role can be played in the wider battle plan.
stratagems.name: Cosmic Precision
stratagems.restrictions: A unit targeted with this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike or Hyperphasing abilities this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the battle, each time an enemy unit takes a Battle-shock or Leadership test, subtract 1 from the result.
stratagems.fluff: With a pulse of necroneural energy that erodes the foe’s will, the Necron commander declares the fall of the enemy general, promising their remaining forces that it is only a matter of time until they join their master in ignoble death.
stratagems.name: Your Time Is Nigh
stratagems.target: Your Necrons Warlord.
stratagems.when: Any phase, just after your opponent’s Warlord is destroyed.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit is destroyed, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking model’s unit has finished making attacks, and is then removed from play.
stratagems.fluff: Lychguard never tire, nor give a thought to their own safety over that of their master. With parrying blows and blocking shots they protect their liege even as they continue to strike down their opponents.
stratagems.name: Sentinels of Eternity
stratagems.target: One Lychguard or Triarch Praetorians unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, an unmodified Hit roll of 5+ scores a Critical Hit.
stratagems.fluff: It is not only android soldiery that be compelled to serve. With a command, prized war engines and ornate weapons are empowered to hyperlethality.
stratagems.name: Enslaved Artifice
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army (excluding Titanic units) that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: A tomb world’s war engines are the pride of its nobility and they will suffer no affront to them, demanding the reassembly of slablike armour atom by atom even as the foe seek to sunder the vehicles.
stratagems.name: Nanoassembly Protocols
stratagems.target: One Necrons Vehicle unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [PRECISION] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Few enemy are worthy of a duel. What dangerous vermin are encountered are prioritised for execution to safeguard the nobles’ honour.
stratagems.name: Suffer No Rival
stratagems.target: One Lychguard or Triarch unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Until the start of your next Command phase, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in your unit. If your unit has the Vehicle keyword, add 3 to the Objective Control characteristic instead.
stratagems.fluff: The ancient and arrogant will of the nobility drives their powerful servants to stand their ground defiantly as they claim the dynasty’s rightful lands.
stratagems.name: Territorial Obsession
stratagems.target: One Lychguard or Triarch unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.

stratagems.effect: After the attacking unit has resolved its attacks, your unit can shoot as if it were your Shooting phase, but it must target only that enemy unit when doing so, and can only do so if that enemy unit is an eligible target.
stratagems.fluff: Criss-cross fire leaps from the Necron ranks, forming a blazing corona of deadly energy to punish those who dare threaten the indignant nobility’s legions.
stratagems.name: Protocol of the Vengeful Stars
stratagems.target: One Necrons Character unit from your army that was within 6" of that Necrons unit when it was destroyed.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit destroys a Necrons unit from your army.

stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by Cryptek or Canoptek models in your unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: Only the foolish tread where a Cryptek has set their sights, for these arcane scientists will suffer no threat to their works.
stratagems.name: Cynosure of Eradication
stratagems.target: One Cryptek or Canoptek unit from your army that is wholly within your army’s Power Matrix.
stratagems.when: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.

stratagems.effect: Remove your Infantry unit from the battlefield and then set it back up anywhere on the battlefield that is wholly within 6" of your Monolith model and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.fluff: Obeying recall protocols, threatened tomb defenders will phase out of existence, only to be relocated to a more advantageous position by the tomb’s hulking Monoliths.
stratagems.name: Hyperphasic Recall
stratagems.target: One Necrons Infantry unit from your army that had one or more of its models destroyed as a result of the attacking unit’s attacks and one friendly Monolith model.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has shot or fought.

stratagems.effect: Your unit is eligible to charge this phase.
stratagems.fluff: As the tomb’s warriors pass through a dimensional displacement corridor, the passage’s surface is lit with data-glyphs providing hyperlogical tactical information. When they step from an eternity gate, they are already prepared for the hunt.
stratagems.name: Dimensional Corridor
stratagems.target: One Necrons unit from your army that was set up on the battlefield this turn using the Eternity Gate ability of a Monolith model that started the turn on the battlefield.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
